dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Seventeen point three billion dollars. That's the net worth of Lee Kun-hee, the top name on this list of South Korea's wealthiest.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seventeen point three billion dollars. That's the net worth of Lee Kun-hee, the top name on this list of South Korea's wealthiest.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #1 Lee Kun-hee $17.3 B 78 Samsung, Samsung Electronics

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he's uh, tied to Hyundai Motor Group, right? That's a massive fortune for one person.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he's uh, tied to Hyundai Motor Group, right? That's a massive fortune for one person.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #1 Lee Kun-hee $17.3 B 78 Samsung, Samsung Electronics

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And look at number two, Seo Jung-jin, with 11.4 billion from online games through Nexon. The gaming industry is clearly huge there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And look at number two, Seo Jung-jin, with eleven point four billion from online games through Nexon. The gaming industry is clearly huge there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #2 Seo Jung-jin $11.4 B 62 biotech, Celltrion #3 Kim Jung-ju $9.6 B 52 online games, Nexon

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh absolutely, and Nexon appears multiple times further down too. But I'm surprised to see biotech in the top three with Kim Jung-ju from Celltrion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh absolutely, and Nexon appears multiple times further down too. But I'm surprised to see biotech in the top three with Kim Jung-ju from Celltrion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #2 Seo Jung-jin $11.4 B 62 biotech, Celltrion #3 Kim Jung-ju $9.6 B 52 online games, Nexon

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Me too! Nine point six billion from biotech firm—that's not something you see every day near the very top of these lists.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Me too! Nine point six billion from biotech firm-that's not something you see every day near the very top of these lists.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #2 Seo Jung-jin $11.4 B 62 biotech, Celltrion #3 Kim Jung-ju $9.6 B 52 online games, Nexon

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then Jay Y. Lee from LG at number four with 6.7 billion. LG is such a household name globally, but still behind some less familiar companies here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Jay Y. Lee from L G at number four with six point seven billion. L G is such a household name globally, but still behind some less familiar companies here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #4 Jay Y. Lee $6.7 B 52 Samsung, Samsung Electronics

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and Samsung's Mong-Koo Chung is actually down at number eight with 3.2 billion, which feels lower than I would've guessed for Samsung.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and Samsung's Mong-Koo Chung is actually down at number eight with three point two billion, which feels lower than I would've guessed for Samsung.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #8 Mong-Koo Chung $3.2 B 82 Hyundai, Hyundai Motor

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that was a bit surprising. And look how many are from pharmaceuticals—Hanmi Holdings has several entries, like Kim Beom-su at five and others further down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that was a bit surprising. And look how many are from pharmaceuticals-Hanmi Holdings has several entries, like Kim Beom-su at five and others further down.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #5 Kim Beom-su $5.2 B 54 online services, Kakao #18 Lim Sung-ki $1.4 B 80 pharmaceuticals, Hanmi Holdings

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely, pharmaceuticals and online services seem really strong. Kakao's Chey Tae-won is at seven with 3.3 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely, pharmaceuticals and online services seem really strong. Kakao's Chey Tae-won is at seven with three point three billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #5 Kim Beom-su $5.2 B 54 online services, Kakao #7 Chey Tae-won $3.3 B 59 oil, semiconductor, SK Holdings

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's Coupang—Koo Kwang-mo at number thirteen from online retail. That's a company a lot of people know nowadays.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's Coupang-Koo Kwang-mo at number thirteen from online retail. That's a company a lot of people know nowadays.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #13 Koo Kwang-mo $1.8 B 42 LG #31 Bom Kim $1 B 41 online retailing, Coupang

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Also interesting how many family names repeat—Lee, Kim, Koo... it feels like certain families dominate the list.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Also interesting how many family names repeat-Lee, Kim, Koo... it feels like certain families dominate the list.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #1 Lee Kun-hee $17.3 B 78 Samsung, Samsung Electronics #3 Kim Jung-ju $9.6 B 52 online games, Nexon #13 Koo Kwang-mo $1.8 B 42 LG

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely, generational wealth and chaebols are a big part of the story here. Even the younger ones, like Bom Kim at thirty-one with a cool billion from retail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely, generational wealth and chaebols are a big part of the story here. Even the younger ones, like Bom Kim at thirty-one with a cool billion from retail.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #31 Bom Kim $1 B 41 online retailing, Coupang

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the age range is pretty wide too—from early forties all the way to eighties. Shows wealth spanning generations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the age range is pretty wide too-from early forties all the way to eighties. Shows wealth spanning generations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: #8 Mong-Koo Chung $3.2 B 82 Hyundai, Hyundai Motor #45 Kim Dae-il $810 M 40 mobile gaming

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True. Overall though, it's striking how concentrated these fortunes are in tech, autos, and pharmaceuticals rather than more traditional industries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True. Overall though, it's striking how concentrated these fortunes are in tech, autos, and pharmaceuticals rather than more traditional industries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, South Korea's economy has really shifted toward innovation in those sectors. This list tells that story perfectly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, South Korea's economy has really shifted toward innovation in those sectors. This list tells that story perfectly.

artist_script:
HostA: Seventeen point three billion dollars. That's the net worth of Lee Kun-hee, the top name on this list of South Korea's wealthiest.
HostB: Yeah, and he's uh, tied to Hyundai Motor Group, right? That's a massive fortune for one person.
HostA: It really is. And look at number two, Seo Jung-jin, with 11.4 billion from online games through Nexon. The gaming industry is clearly huge there.
HostB: Oh absolutely, and Nexon appears multiple times further down too. But I'm surprised to see biotech in the top three with Kim Jung-ju from Celltrion.
HostA: Me too! Nine point six billion from biotech firm—that’s not something you see every day near the very top of these lists.
HostB: And then Jay Y. Lee from LG at number four with 6.7 billion. LG is such a household name globally, but still behind some less familiar companies here.
HostA: Right, and Samsung’s Mong-Koo Chung is actually down at number eight with 3.2 billion, which feels lower than I would’ve guessed for Samsung.
HostB: Yeah, that was a bit surprising. And look how many are from pharmaceuticals—Hanmi Holdings has several entries, like Kim Beom-su at five and others further down.
HostA: Definitely, pharmaceuticals and online services seem really strong. Kakao’s Chey Tae-won is at seven with 3.3 billion.
HostB: And then there's Coupang—Koo Kwang-mo at number thirteen from online retail. That's a company a lot of people know nowadays.
HostA: For sure. Also interesting how many family names repeat—Lee, Kim, Koo... it feels like certain families dominate the list.
HostB: Absolutely, generational wealth and chaebols are a big part of the story here. Even the younger ones, like Bom Kim at thirty-one with a cool billion from retail.
HostA: And the age range is pretty wide too—from early forties all the way to eighties. Shows wealth spanning generations.
HostB: True. Overall though, it's striking how concentrated these fortunes are in tech, autos, and pharmaceuticals rather than more traditional industries.
HostA: Yeah, South Korea’s economy has really shifted toward innovation in those sectors. This list tells that story perfectly.
